intro: Hemitelia hookeri, commonly known as the New Zealand hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a creeping habit with lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the harsh maritime climate. Hemitelia hookeri plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
